trans-unit.source: Allows the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer"></xref> to recognize a type when it serializes or deserializes an object.

Use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIncludeAttribute> when you call the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Serialize%2A> or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize%2A> method of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> class.
When applying the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIncludeAttribute>, specify the <xref:System.Type> of the derived class.
When the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> serializes objects that include both the base and the derived class, it can then recognize both object types.
You can use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIncludeAttribute> to include derived classes in service description documents that are written in the Web Services Description Language (WSDL).
For example, if a method returns an <xref:System.Object>, apply the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIncludeAttribute> to the method and specify the actual types to return.
For more information on the WSDL, see "Web Services Description Language (WSDL) 1.1" at www.w3.org.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIncludeAttribute"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the object to include.
Gets or sets the type of the object to include.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the object to include.
